Colophon

This is the colophon page. A polite nod to the reader's curiosity. A recognition to the tools and software that were used in creation of this website.

Before we go any further, I would like to get one thing straight: this is a personal site and the thoughts and opinions expressed here are entirely my own. This site is in no way connected with my employment, past or present, and absolutely nothing I've written should be taken as expressing or implying anything on my employer's behalf.

There are two custom fonts used in this website, they are - "Open Sans" and "Poly". Both of them are avaliable in Google Web Font.

This website uses Jekyll to generate all it's pages. And it's hosted on Github for convenience. You can check out the source code on Github.

I always have a Terminal window open when I am working. MacVim is my weapon of choice. Git is my prefered version control. Chrome is currently my preferred browser, however I change browser all the time. Occasionally I open up Adobe Photoshop to do some graphical related stuff, but I try to avoid doing so as much as posible.

If jshamsul.com looks goofy in your browser, most probably because you are using a shitty web browser. My guess would be an older version of Internet Explorer. Complaint all you want, I donâ€™t care less. Get yourself another browser.

However, if you do think that you are using a modern, standards-compliant browser and are having trouble viewing this website, please do let me know.
